ing: 4 pounds Snow Crab clusters, thawed if necessary
des: "When it comes to crab you have 3 options: you can go to the expensive seafood place for overpriced, soggy, and bland crab; you can ruin it yourself at home;  or you can follow this recipe and have crab so good you will never eat it any other way."
ins:
Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat. When hot, lightly oil grate.
Whisk together the olive oil, butter, and garlic; generously brush onto crab.
Cook crab on preheated grill, turning once, until the shell begins to brown, about 6 minutes.
